content.introduction:
Suggests removal of unnecessary calls to 
absl::StrCat
 when the result is
being passed to another call to 
absl::StrCat
 or 
absl::StrAppend
.

The extra calls cause unnecessary temporary strings to be constructed. Removing
them makes the code smaller and faster.

Examples:

std
::
string
 
s
 
=
 
absl
::
StrCat
(
"A"
,
 
absl
::
StrCat
(
"B"
,
 
absl
::
StrCat
(
"C"
,
 
"D"
)));


//before



std
::
string
 
s
 
=
 
absl
::
StrCat
(
"A"
,
 
"B"
,
 
"C"
,
 
"D"
);


//after



absl
::
StrAppend
(
&
s
,
 
absl
::
StrCat
(
"E"
,
 
"F"
,
 
"G"
));


//before



absl
::
StrAppend
(
&
s
,
 
"E"
,
 
"F"
,
 
"G"
);


//after
